title: Very good doctors
body: I was able to book a few days in advance with the doctor of my choice who I usually see so that is really helpful as the doctor knows me and knows my health issues. I have had very good care and the doctor is so thorough and always very helpful . The staff on reception are  friendly and helpful aswell .

title: Great example of easy access
body: I joined this surgery around 8 months ago, I have nothing but praise, I am so pleased with how easy it has been to request a repeat prescription, I simply left a voicemail on Friday afternoon and my prescription was delivered to my home address today (Monday), great example of coordinated care and seamless pathway! A great example to other GP practices

author: Katood123
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Psychology Group Feedback 4
body:
1)How did you find the group?  
I have really enjoyed coming to the group! The ladies have been amazing in helping us all in understanding the skills, and its been so nice to meet new people + be included in something and make new friends.  
2)What was the most helpful part of the group and why?  
Learning all the different techniques to help support myself has been really helpful. I use different ones on different days depending how I feel and its really helped.  
3)What was the least helpful part and why?  
I donâ€™t feel any of it was not helpful but it is sometimes triggering when talking about things  
4)What would you change about the group/would like to be different?  
I thought the group was great. Can't think of anything I would change.  
5)How helpful has the group been in addressing and understanding your difficulties?  
They have helped come so from where I was, and they have also given me the confidence in getting better and helping myself.  
6)How did you fund the facilitators?  
Great, they have been amazing.  
7)Any other comments?  
I will miss coming to the group a lot!

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

author: Katood123
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Psychology group feedback 2
body:
Emotional Coping Skills (ECS) Group 2023 â€“ Feedback Form
1)	How did you find the group?
Very helpful in building confidence around strangers, and grounding skills good for coping with emotional distress



2)	What was the most helpful part of the group and why?

Grounding skills for help calming down from anxiety attacks
ACE skills for acknowledging achievements at my own pace and level


3)	What was the least helpful part and why?
Social/relationships skills as difficult to practise, and tricky to apply in real life
Opposite action also, understood n theory but donâ€™t think it easily applies to me

 

4)	What would you change about the group/would like to be different?
Something like a table surface to write on. 
Digital copy of the booklet also, with link to view videos shown in the session â€“ would save emailing links.



5)	How helpful has the group been in addressing and understanding your difficulties?


Very, I feel able to apply most of the skills and able to adapt to my needs. Doesnâ€™t fully address the source of all my difficulties, but I didnâ€™t expect that. 

6)	How did you find the facilitators? 
Very kind, helpful and welcoming. They had wonderful insights and support throughout. 


7)	Any other comments?
Thank you so much! ðŸ˜Š

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

author: Katood123
authorRole: a service user
title: Psychology group feedback
body:
Emotional Coping Skills (ECS) Group 2023 â€“ Feedback Form
1)	How did you find the group?
very scepticle at first but learnt very helpful skills to help me in the future.



2)	What was the most helpful part of the group and why?

Having someone to share our troubles with, knowing we are not alone.


3)	What was the least helpful part and why?
-

 

4)	What would you change about the group/would like to be different?

Would have liked to continue for a little longer


5)	How helpful has the group been in addressing and understanding your difficulties?

Everybody helped with sharing our experiences


6)	How did you find the facilitators? 

10-out of 10- will practice and use these everyday.

7)	Any other comments?
Just Thank you so much for the help.

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

author: Katood123
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Psychology group feedback 3
body:
Emotional Coping Skills (ECS) Group 2023 â€“ Feedback Form
1)	How did you find the group?
I found the Group really helpful.
And the people in the group also were nice + kind



2)	What was the most helpful part of the group and why?
Self smoothing,



3)	What was the least helpful part and why?
None!

 

4)	What would you change about the group/would like to be different?

Learning more skills.


5)	How helpful has the group been in addressing and understanding your difficulties?
It has helped me a lot and now my skills are improving. Still got to do more.



6)	How did you find the facilitators? 

Really helpful and understanding

7)	Any other comments?
If we had some refreshments on the 8 week course or after our course was finished. Lol ðŸ˜Š and I would like to say a huge thank you for everything you have done for me ðŸ˜Š x

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

title: Frustrated
body: I try and avoid going to the doctors, but sometimes you just have to. The last 3 occasions I have tried to get an appointment, has proved to be very difficult. 1st time made 264 calls before I was connected 2nd time 217, 3rd time 238 to then be told no appointments available. Finger on the redial button from 8am. Recently, I received a text to contact the surgery regarding blood tests, when I finally got through, nobody knew what I was talking about. I would like to know how a practice can advertise they are taking new patients when the ones they have cannot get through via telephone or get an appointment.

title: Great service
body: I had time to talk to the doctor. I never felt I was on a time limit and she was very thorough with the problems I had.

title: Pacemaker replacement
body: I had a pacemaker replaced 22-04-23. Everything very efficient and quick. Do not live in Norwich and do not have a car so the pre assessment phone call was wonderful. Had my yearly check 22-02-23 and found I needed a replacement pacemaker. By the 22-04-23 new one fitted. Male & female nurses were so kind . Well Done everyone.

title: Fast efficient treatment
body: I was given an infusion of COVID anti viral treatment on a bank holiday. I was very grateful for the expert care as I look after my husband who has Alzheimerâ€™s.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield
Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Efficient Effective and Compassionate
body: My 90 year old mother had an asthma attack Friday evening.  Every member of the hospital who treated her embraced their duties with the utmost respect, professionalism and compassion.  She spent time in A&E and in the AMU and I'd be grateful if you could forward my sincere thanks to them.

title: I am troubled
body: Appointments for the doctor have become problematic now there are no appointments she must have waited hours in line on the phone and in the end they say there are no appointments I am outraged and troubled I am sorry

title: Terrible service
body: Feel itâ€™s important for others to know the service is appalling, would avoid this surgery at all costs. If you want an appointment be prepared to wait a long time regardless of your circumstances. Communication is also shocking.

author: HH05
authorRole: a service user
title: Prejudiced and lacking care
body:
During my pregnancy I feel my care was subpar compared to others due to my weight. My midwife automatically assumed I was diabetic at my booking appointment and had to correct the tick box after clicking yes to diabetes before asking me the question. They also made comments about my occupation, as I'm in training.  
I was made to spread my booking appointment over 2 appointments, with them making a comment about having actual babies in the community to see to, so I didnâ€™t have my urine tested or bloods done, and their bedside manner was just not very comforting.  
I have found out now, from a friend, (6wks postpartum) that I shouldâ€™ve been offered free vitamins on prescription during my pregnancy, which I wasnâ€™t aware of at all as it wasnâ€™t discussed with me by my midwife.  
I had no way of contacting my midwife until I was around 20wks pregnant as I wasn't given a contact number. I wasnâ€™t offered antenatal classes until I was around 35wks pregnant, making my child about a month older than those in my group, some are yet to give birth!  
I had great experiences with other midwives from the unit, and heard positive things from others I knew that were pregnant at the same time as me, all of which had other midwives. I feel my experience wouldâ€™ve been a more positive one if I wasnâ€™t made to feel bad about my weight and occupation, and generally made to feel like I wasnâ€™t supported throughout my pregnancy by my own midwife.

readBy.name: NHS Grampian
Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Extra mile
body: My recent experience at my surgery was outstanding. The Dr who dealt with me had a terrific manner and explained everything , he also didnâ€™t over promise and all tests and appointments were achieved. I would recommend the Dr to anyone for â€˜going the extra mile â€˜making me feel comfortable and ensuring I understood the issues Thank you

title: Friendly and efficient
body: Attended today for an outpatient consultation,   staff were friendly and very efficient, a big  thankyou to everyone

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic  locum doctor
body: Saw a locum doctor, was fantastic, she listened patiently and was thorough. Receptionist not friendly at all, made me feel very uncomfortable and was not treated with respect.

title: Non communicative
body: Communication is dire, issue with phone lines. Impossible to contact even to change or amend an appointment. wrong telephone numbers on correspondance,  yet expectations for their patients to be prompt and communicative is a little hypocritical. This is the start of my treatment and it does not bode well. Attitude is not overly apologetic despite the 1hr 40 mins trying to contact. Exasperating.

title: Booking an appointment
body: I have tried on two occasions in the last week to book an appointment which after a great deal of persistence (35 calls)I achieved â€¦.the problem is the way the telephone system has been set up â€¦which the receptionist blamed on BT which I suspect isnâ€™t the case as most telephony systems are unique to the business and should be set up in houseâ€¦The problem is calls are redirected to a messaging system which doesnâ€™t exist â€¦stating due to volume of calls agents are unavailable..this isnâ€™t good enough itâ€™s not only very expensive to keep calling but itâ€™s putting lives at risk

title: Canâ€™t even contact them.
body:
The app to book an appointment is always down and says to check back the following day. 

The phone rings out and no one answers. 

Canâ€™t even contact the GP

title: Paediatric ED and Ward 10 RVI fab staff andâ€¦
body: Myself and my partner had to bring our newborn daughter into the hospital as she wasnâ€™t keeping her feeds down. This was a very stressful time made worse by the fact that I was recovering from a c section. The staff in ED both doctors and nurses were very supportive and couldnâ€™t do enough for us to ensure we were comfortable and our daughter was treated quickly. We were then transferred to ward 10 where the nurses took fantastic care of us throughout our stay. The nurses were very knowledgeable and able to offer support and advice as to how to manage our daughters problem while in hospital and at home. The surgical and paediatric registrars/consultants were also fantastic and very thorough and we canâ€™t thank the whole team enough.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great patient experience
body: I did have to wait nearly 4 months for this appointment. However, I had a very positive experience at the ophthalmology outpatient department today. Because patients can be there a while, a free hot drink was offered which was well received by patients . The ophthalmologist explained  my diagnosis in a way which was easy for me to understand . He gave time for me to ask questions and gave me some helpful advice. All the staff in the department were friendly and explained what they were doing. It was my first time at the clinic and I was anxious, but the staff were great.Thank you

title: Receptionists seem to think they DRs
body: I have been trying to see the GP for ever, I called my GP sugary because I  keep having dizzy fainty episodes with serious headaches wanting to vomit and my heart bitting so fast, the recipient's would not give me emergency appointment they told me that my symptoms don't come under emergency. Ever time I  call my GP practice to book an appointment the receptionists want me to tell them exactly what I am suffering from some time it's embarrassing to explain my condition to a recipient's when I know they are not my Dr. Some times I have to ask my husband to book my appointments just because they never do question him or refuse to give him appointments for me. Recipient's shouldn't pretend to be Dr's. I suffer from autoimmune disease which is quite debilitating sometimes ðŸ˜”. Waiting to see a GP for 4 to 5 weeks is not right. The hospital emergency is full of people like.

title: Very good experience
body: I am new to Colchester, so obviously a new patent. Turner Roadâ€™ took me on, because the surgeries nearer to my home (on the opposite side of town) have closed their books. Despite the negative reviews that I have read, I have found the GP whom I had an appointment with, the nurse that took my blood sample and the receptionists, to be fantastic. The receptionist whom I spoke to last week, went out of her way to assist me with my query about repeat prescriptions. For all of this, I am very grateful. Thank youâ€¦.

author: Services1
authorRole: a service user
title: Covid service
body: I was feeling upset also was crying because of being in lockdown for a while but I'm all right now.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I have a lot of trust in all of them
body:
The care that I have gotten so far in the hospital has been really good and I haven't had an issue with the care I have gotten.  
I am very thankful for the staff as all of them have been absolutely great, all very nice people and I have a lot of trust in all of them.  
There are some things get lost in communication however I understand enough to know what they are on about. I've no issues since I was admitted I really have been happy enough

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great hospital
body: I had my toe fusion on the 12/04/2023, I was so nervous but shouldnâ€™t have worried as the surgeon made me feel so relaxed & put me at ease, and the staff were Amazing, I think this has to be the best hospital I have been to, so far my toe is healing perfectly with hardly any pain whatsoever, itâ€™s only been 2 weeks but I expected much worse after having the procedure done, I would just like to say a very big thank you to everyone that works on this unit, they are fantastic people, and I for one would never be afraid of going there again, well done to all and a big thank you from me

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Have been communicating excellently
body: Staff have all been absolutely great so far really pleased with my care and treatment. I haven't had an issue at all with the staff as they have been just great. They are all really nice and have been communicating excellently with me i feel like i understand all of them. The foods been alright i feel i dont have a massive appetite but i dont mind it at all. Cleaning was great everything's kept very well and i haven a problem at all

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff up here are absolutely wonderful
body: 1 North has been just great so far and i really dont think that i have had a single issue with my time in 1 north. Staff up here are absolutely wonderful so far really all of them have been just great and take a great amount of time making sure that i understand everything which i appreciate as it gives me a great deal of reassurance. I haven't had an issue since i got admitted and just hope that i get out soon.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: An excellent ward to recover in
body: 1 North has been an excellent ward to recover in and i feel like the care couldn't be better anywhere else. The staff all treat me with such kindness everyday they have been excellent i really couldn't ask for better. They all take the time to ask me how im doing and if anything needs to be explained they always help me with is. There just great. As is everything in the hospital wither it be food the cleanliness or the ward.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great GP practice
body: My family and I have been visiting the Westbury Avenue GP practice for Almost 20 years, and we have always been satisfied with the care and services. Today was no different from previous visitation to the practice. I went to pickup my motherâ€™s Urine test kit and I didnâ€™t need to wait long as it was ready in less than five minutes. Along with providing efficient services, the doctors, Practice manager and receptionist are all friendly and helpful.

author: Barry the beard
authorRole: the patient
title: My mobile MRI
body:
I was given an urgent referral by my GP in July 2022 due to stomach pains. In October I had a telephone appointment with a consultant who sent me for an ultrasound. I was diagnosed with gallstones.  
In December I was sent a letter saying I needed an MRI. Mid April I was sent a letter saying to book a MRI giving me a number to ring. It is nearly impossible to get through as they are always extremely busy and ask you to hang up and try again later. Nearly 9months from an urgent referral nothing has actually been done to alleviate my pain.  
The booing service is abysmal. The MRI was very professional and well done.

readBy.name: NHS Highland

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I haven't had a problem with a thing about my care
body:
The care so far has been great really haven't a problem with a thing.  
The staff are nice have all done a great job with me and I feel like there isn't much more that they could do in making me feel better.  
I have been able to understand them easily enough they explain everything and have answered my questions very well. I haven't had a problem with a thing about my care - just hope I get out of here soon

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: 5 star care in the hospital
body: The care that I have gotten in the hospital is 5-star really has been crucial. The staff have all been lovely I really couldn't rate them as I truly believe that they have been perfect with me. There just great and I haven't really had an issue with a single one of them they have all been lovely people and I haven't had an issue with any of them. They have explained things great I feel like I'm aware of what's happening and when I'm getting home

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: April123
authorRole: the patient
title: Lovely & fantastic midwives
body:
I was taken into the RIE ward 119 for an induction and was very nervous, however I had such a lovely & fantastic midwife, Martha who went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable and explain everything with me and just having a general chat really helped calm my nerves. I was then taken round to labour ward and was looked after by two amazing midwifeâ€™s Claire & Kate. Claire & Kate were both so supportive and compassionate and made me and my husband feel comfortable.  
Unfortunately, I had to have an emergency c section due to my baby having a very high heart rate and I was absolutely terrified but Kate and the Doctors were absolutely fantastic and explained everything thoroughly before the operation. Both my husband and I cannot thank all the staff at the RIE maternity wards for delivering our beautiful baby girl. You are all a credit to your profession and a fine example of NHS values.

readBy.name: NHS Lothian

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Best part of the care has been the staff
body:
The care in the hospital has been nothing short of incredible, I really am pleased with the care that I have gotten since admission.  
The reason the care is so good is every part of the care.  
The food has been great as has the ward environment but the true best part of the care has been the staff. All of them doesn't matter the role or day or night they have all been really nice.  
I really don't have a bad word to say as all of them have been so nice

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: You will never get an appointment
body:
They open at 8am dont expect to get an appointment that day as you'll find out when you call you will be 40 (sometimes 60+) in the queue to get through. When you do you'll be quizzed by the reception staff as so why you want an appointment, then to be told they have nothing for that date anymore.

Unfortunately you cant make appointments in advance in unless its for a nurse but to be told you need to ring the next day at the same time to be in same situation on hold for 50+ mins to be told they have nothing is frustrating (I done this 4 times and still nothing) unfortunately not everyone works from home and cant just drop things to be at an appointment in the middle of the day or wants to have a conversation regarding there health concerns which is private at work but it seems like everyone has forgotten that.

So if you want to see a doctor or speak to them about anything expect to be seen nearly a week later when you finally get through to there shocking phone system which each time they tell you is new but they've had it for nearly a year so this cant keep being an excuse for the phone lines.

author: Alexis1969
authorRole: a service user
title: Exemplary care
body: As a former midwife and a current paediatric physiotherapist it's not often I get to experience care from the other side. My daughter gave birth in the bathroom of ward 2E yesterday and I need to express my gratitude. The care provided not only for my daughter but for the whole family was exemplary. Each member of the staff from the midwives to the domestic provided professional and heartfelt support. They made me proud to be a part of the NHS and are a credit to Whiston hospital, if the NHS need a benchmark then it is the care given on ward 2E at Whiston hospital.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Great knowledge and understanding
body:
Daisy ward is excellent. The treatment my son has been receiving is amazing, I have seen him gradually getting better thankfully. It scared me the way he was but the staff did not panic and got him stable. The place is clean and it is cleaned regularly. The staff are amazing. They have kept me informed every step of the way and let me ask any questions I have.  
Daisy ward has great knowledge and understanding.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Everything with my care has been absolutely great
body:
Everything with my care has been absolutely great so far really haven't an issue with a thing.  
The reason I have no issues is the staff that I have looking after me. I really don't think that I could ask for a better group of professionals that have been looking after me there all absolutely lovely and have been so nice.  
They have explained things just great I feel they have been so easy to understand as well as the food which has been excellent.  
I really haven't had a problem at all no issues with the care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Their communication has been very good indeed
body:
3 south has provided me with a level of care I can be happy with and have nothing bad to say about the ward.  
My only issue is the lack of variety as the menu doesn't change.  
3 South has been great though, a ward in excellent condition and has been kept very clean and has amazing staff.  
The staff have been so kind and their communication has been very good indeed

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great Maternity Team
body: Frimley Park had an absolute amazing maternity team all the way from my booking appt to the delivery of my son. They were extremely helpful all the way through and very accommodating to my needs (moving house midway through and completely being in a new county). The midwives work so hard to give us the best experience and they really did. Very well informed throughout my induction followed by great staff throughout a horrible labour and a lovely postnatal team, when my partner had to leave after visiting hours were over in the post natal ward- they offered to look after my little one so I could get some sleep. Thank you so much for your care throughout the 41 weeks!

readBy.name: Frimley Health NHS Foundation Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I understand I'd say 95 percent of it.
body:
I am pleased with the care that I have been getting as so far the hospital has been treating me excellent.  
I don't really have an appetite but what I have ate has been good.  
Staff such as nurses doctors actually all of them have been very nice and I have seen the physio too which were great.  
Everything has been pretty well explained I understand I'd say 95 percent of it. I don't have any problems though the cares great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Used to be good, signs of not coping appearing.
body:
As Sherburn in Elmet has grown and the pandemic happened. The GP service has declined. Care by staff is great but getting an appointment, getting a phone call answered and even trying to use online services is getting difficult. I can only book a blood test online as GP Appointment booking was removed when Covid started and the facility has not returned.

The recent change to System One has been awful. Repeat prescription requests have not succeeded two month on the trot as the Airmid Phone Apps seems unable to pass the request to a clinician to review. Iâ€™ve ended up having to take additional time out of work to visit and resolve.

Iâ€™m looking at alternative GP services and seeing if Tadcaster Medical Centre are taking patients.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Blown away by how great the staff were
body:
3 south has been absolutely great since I came into the hospital. The moment I came in I was blown away by how great the staff were, always checking up on me and taking the time to explain what they are doing and why, allowing me to answer questions and generally being great.  
They're fantastic I couldn't ask for better. I haven't an issue with a thing in my care and am incredibly grateful for everything

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Fantastic practice
body: I have only been at this surgery 10 months and they are absolutely amazing, always have appointments available for my baby twins. I receive text message to remind me of appointments etc which is great! This is the best surgery in the b45 area! All the staff are lovely and really helpful. Canâ€™t recommend them enough!

title: Excellent, knowledge,  help recommend 100 percentâ€¦
body:
Attended pain Management with the consultant,  who was excellent in explaining, took time and patience with me. 
So very kind, supportive and in his guidance and advice I genuinely know he wants the best for me in terms of treatment.
The whole department work together as an excellent team and the nursing staff care, and are efficient. I would recommend pain management clinic Preston. They are incredibly helpful and kind. Thank you for all your hard work, with me and my complex health problems.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body:
From opticians  referral to cataract surgery was 12 days, including assessment.  Welcoming staff who explained everything  from first visit to discharge, made to feel very welcome. Appointment  8.30, arrived around 8.20, ready for discharge 9.50, quick but not rushed , surgeon discussed my problems but we overcome them, now awaiting the second  operation. 
Would definitely  recommend  SpaMedica  Leeds

title: Friendly and efficient practice
body: I am a new patient and so far have found that reception staff are friendly and approachable. I have seen the  3 nurses so far and all were friendly. The Dr that I visited on the day was knowledgeable and understanding. In addition phones are answered in a timely manner and appointments to see Dr's are also allocated timely. I Should have moved surgery sooner. Keep up the good service.

author: 75 year old
authorRole: the patient
title: Minor injuries unit Qn Elizabeth Hosp Glasgow
body: Fell on pavement and because I had my hands in pockets my teeth went into top lip inside my mouth. The nurse practitioner had a caring manner and was very proficient.

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

title: No communication
body: I was due for an operation on 28th March for Kidney Stones but on 24th it was cancelled by phone.  I rang a week later to see what was happening and was told that I hadn't been forgotten  I have rung and left 4 messages since then with no response.  I have had to listen to the Circle Health puff re customer care each time - not impressed.

readBy.name: BMI Healthcare Ltd

title: Appalling practice
body:
At my request I was prescribed HRT. No health checks were done, and minimal, generic questions asked.  
As I was experiencing severe side effects, I tried exhaustively to get through to speak to a Dr, without success.  I emailed the practice to explain what I was experiencing,  and merely got a text message saying a different HRT had been prescribed,  still no health checks. 
I recently tried once again to speak to a Dr to no avail,  for a repeat prescription,  and to be advised about different side effects,  so ended up emailing the practice again, and received an email response saying the repeat prescription had been issued, and if I wanted to speak to someone about my side effects , to call at 8am for an appointment.  I replied saying this was never successful, and as I also work it isn't possible to hang on the phone for over an hour, but got no response. 
As a post menopausal woman,  I have other health concerns, but no chance of speaking to anyone about these. 
I've also tried to change surgery,  but have been told we are not in the catchment area.

title: Shockingly bad
body:
The care service provided after the recent merger is non existent, there is no possibility of booking any kind of appointment - it appears that all of the telephone calls, for what used to be 4 GP surgeries, are now answered by 1 receptionist so the average waiting time is 40 minutes just to find out that there is nothing available and you can call, again in 2 weeks. 
I've tried using online services and Patchs app, but the functionality is terrible and there are no available appointments to book.

Extremely disappointing.

title: Brilliant appointment
body: Helped kindly by reception staff to sort out an issue. At appointment Doctor was absolutely brilliant with me and listened and understood. So patient also. Came out feeling totally heard and 100% happy with the advice given.

title: Shocking systems and appointment service
body:
I am now on week 2 of trying to call to make a doctors appointment, and so far today 88 minutes of waiting to get through to somebody, starting with being 'over 30 people in the queue'. It's impossible when working a full time job to keep taking hours out of my day to wait and try and make the front of the queue.
When I finally get to see or speak to a doctor this practice is great and I would recommend the help I have received in the past, but I can't believe getting an appointment is this difficult. Tried to go into the practice in person and they wont let me make an appointment in person, get referred back to the phone line.
I understand the strains of the NHS, but none of my family or friends have this much trouble getting through to the receptionist to try and make an appointment, and many are at alternative local surgeries. I'm surprised it is deemed acceptable to not even be able to get through on the phone after hours of trying. 
A surgery shouldn't take on more patients than the systems can function for. It's such a shame because this practice used to be the best in the area and the staff are always helpful.

title: worst practice
body:
I have been coming to this practice since I was a little girl, however, as now I am in my 40s with children, my family has also been coming here, but as the years have passed by, this practice has gone from good, to bad to the worst practice ever in Medway. The practice is not very welcoming or helpful, especially at the reception. You ask them for any sort of help you do not get the help, whether it's face-to-face or via phone. I pay my taxes, we should not be treated like this, this makes me think why should they get paid more when they don't treat their patients well? 

If you have children and are someone elderly, I would not recommend wasting your time on this practice. 

I am now looking for a better service practice.

author: PatMustard85
authorRole: the patient
title: Good A&E experience
body:
Up at A&E on Easter Monday. There was about 15-20 in front of me. I found the department to quite efficient and run smoothly. They opened up 2nd triage and there where plenty of doctors working through cases.  
Nurse and Doctors introduced themselves and communicated well with me at my level.  
Was in and out within 2 hours.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Content in 4 south
body: On Thursday night, I began to experience excruciating pain in my side/ tummy area. The pain was spreading so I had no choice but to be driven to A+E. The wait was extremely long, especially in such discomfort, however that was to be expected. I am now situated in 4 south and medication has kept the pain at bay. Appendicitis was ruled out so the doctors are still unsure was is causing the pain. I feel very content in 4 south as the staff are attentive and approachable. The only issue I have is the stifling heat and noise at night time, I appreciate that these things are not easy controlled but something could definitely be done about the temperature as it restricts patients sleep. Other than this, I couldnâ€™t complain.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Marc from Glasgow
authorRole: the patient
title: My stay in Ward 9A at QEUH Glasgow
body:
I went in for major surgery last week and as someone who's never really had any serious health issues, this was a big deal to me.  
I spent 5 days in Ward 9A and everyone there was really supportive; I feel their attitude and actions helped greatly with my recovery. I wanted to express how comfortable, informed, and involved everyone at QEUH Glasglow made me feel.

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

title: Unable to get any appointments with this Practice.
body:
I have been self monitoring my high blood pressure for some time now, and was given an all day telephone appointment (no specific time) to discuss my readings with a clinician.
Due to circumstances beyond my control, I unfortunately missed their telephone call.
The surgery has subsequently made no effort to contact me again.
This practice uses the "Anima" online system for patients to access their services. Upon trying to book another appointment, the online system only opens at 08.00 Monday to Friday, and as soon as the system goes online, after logging in, you are informed that the practice is at full capacity, and not currently taking any new requests. This has been the case at a couple of minutes past 8 o'clock for the past 10 days.
Any attempt to telephone the surgery is met with a recorded message to use their preferred Anima system, but continuing with the call puts you in a queue, usually with around 80 callers ahead of you.
The queue slowly goes down at a rate of about 9 callers every half hour, but when my position in the queue reached the upper 40's, the line went blank for a few seconds, and then without redialling, reset my position back to the upper 80's.
My last remaining option was to walk down to the surgery, only to be asked by the receptionist why I wasn't using the Anima system. When I replied that I wasn't able to get any kind of an appointment online, I was told that the Anima system was working perfectly. I mentioned the problems I'd had on the phone, and was told I should have been using Anima!
I asked the receptionist what I could do to get an appointment, and was told that there was nothing available today, and she couldn't book any other appointments. She suggested to return to the surgery in person at 08.00 tomorrow, only to be told there were again no appointments.
In spite of the fact that the practice is always "at full capacity", their huge waiting rooms are always empty.
My wife has had a similar experience trying to book appointments for herself, so despite being reasonably intelligent and computer literate, we've more or less given up any attempt to access NHS medical care through our GP. This practice has effectively firewalled itself behind the Anima computer system, long queues on the phone, and a receptionist who is unable to make appointments.
NHS111 are not able to help with high blood pressure as this needs the attention of a GP.
We will not attend A&E to receive treatment, as we are neither an accident nor an emergency.
Having both paid National Insurance contributions all of our working lives, we find that now, at 70 years of age, we are effectively being denied medical care by way of having no access to a GP.
I know we will only receive the usual generic, cut & paste, computer generated reply that other patients have received, as I really don't believe that a real person ever reads these reviews.

title: Frustrating appointment system
body:
Rang at the start of the day to get an appointment was on hold for over half an hour to be told to ring back at lunch there were no appointments left, rang back bang on 12 noon again on hold for over 30 minutes to be told again there was nothing they could do I needed to call back again tomorrow.
The frustrating part was while I was on hold there was no up date to tell me was number I was so I wasn't even sure if I had been cut off.
I normally I don't have an issue with getting an appointment but this is happening more and more and this hold system needs addressing.

title: Terrible service making contact
body:
Number on letter by address is incorrect
Number at footer answers 'the person you called is unavailable'
Got number from website and after several options got through to amazing individual.
The front end of your service needs attention to make it much more user friendly for elderly pople!!!!

title: Dreadful administration
body: As usual , I find that the practice cannot be bothered to update my records by reading , understanding and acting upon letters from U C L H concerning my appointments,  health and/or prescription updates. This is quite shocking. And then it takes over an hour to get through to the Surgery to speak to someone about it.  A nice receptionist, who, because of your streamlined procedures, cannot put me through to any one to talk to about the changes needed in my prescribed drugs. Result? Repeat prescription will be delayed. Please note that this is not the first time this has happened. I now realise that letters from consultants are not even read or attached to my notes. If they were, then why are repeat prescriptions not changed as a result? This is not an acceptable level of service. Get a grip, for goodness sakes. Practice Management needs to be improved, or better still changed..

readBy.name: City & Hackney GP Confederation

title: Fantastic staff.
body: Staff went above and beyond to make my partner comfortable and worked unbelievably hard to get him home to pass away,this was his wish to die at home and my god the staff were absolutely amazing

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good service
body: I was fitted me in within a hour of me sending my email with my concern and was give a wide variety of appointment time to choose from, the nurse a saw was very officiant and referred me to QA straight away

title: Not good
body: Absoutley awlful, I tried calling for an on the day appointment, dead on 8, to receive the message that all were already gone, regestered online to try and make an online appointment, none avaliable, i'm not quite sure what i'm meant to do, I really need to see the doctor. About a year ago I made an appointment for a phone consultation, never received that call either. Really disspointed.

title: Worst practice Iâ€™ve ever have been registered
body: Been registered in this practice for more than 2 years and never managed to get an appointment for me, my wife or my son. They ask to call 8am and when you call they never answer. When they do, around 9, they ask you to call at 8am next day. Just today I called 18 times and no one cares to even answer the call.

title: Almost impossible to get through
body: Almost impossible to get through on the telephone even at 8am in the morning. On the telephone you select option 1 for appointments then get told automatically that it's busy and are cut off. You cannot be left on hold and kept in a queue. Never able to book online appointments, this has been the case for 3 years or more. At one time they did a call back option but this has stopped. Not sure how anyone gets to see a doctor at this practice. Complete failure of a practice as you can't even get through on the phone to even get an appointment.

title: Shockingly Woeful Service
body:
I've been caller number 1 in the que for the past 10mins. 
Recorded greeting directs patients to the mobile app which either doesn't provide required service or fails to alert practice of requests. Most frustratingly, ordering a repeat prescription is near impossible without making a formal complaint. Horrible service every time

title: fantastic treatment
body: I had breast surgery last week apart from the initial wait in the elective surgery which was terrible unprofessional and no confidentiality whatsoever, the anethasists, doctors and nurses were fantastic helpful and caring.  They made me feel very comfortable and at ease

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fast response to result
body: Quick follow-up after visit, after spotting cholesterol was slightly higher than last year. When explained the reason for this, next year's test will be before Easter, to prevent a similar situation.

title: Reception staff are terrible
body:
Iâ€™ve called and been to this practice multiple times. Every time I feel the reception staff cannot be bothered and it feels like they are doing you a huge favour by giving you an appointment.

When at the practice they do not seem to listen to you and go through what feels like the same script every time even if the response you get doesnâ€™t answer the question asked.

Probably one of the worst customer facing teams Iâ€™ve come across. They need a lot of training on how to interact with the public.

author: circinusnc55
authorRole: a service user
title: Location of service
body:
The building is hard to spot. As, there is no obvious signage to the exterior of the building. The building is in an office block. Which does not seem at all big enough for the services it provides. Which I imagine is a lot.  
I came today to have my coil taken out and to get another form of contraception. I arrived late for my appointment as I was not aware that there was no parking. When I telephoned the Stafford number on open clinic to make an appointment. I wasnâ€™t told that there wasnâ€™t any parking. I arrived straight from work and was shocked to see no parking. The building is not easily accessible for anyone to get to. Unless you travel by train. Why would you put a sexual health clinic in the middle of an office/industrial estate?  
This service used to be at elsewhere. Which seemed like a much more appropriate place for a sexual health service. Or at least a building that is fit for purpose. The nurse I saw was absolutely wonderful and put me at ease and was considerate of my needs. Thank goodness for the nurse. If not for her it would have been a terrible experience.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

title: Rubbish
body:
Had my first appt for restorative services in nov. Had the next scheduled for dec which I had to cancel due to covid and I was informed I'd get another through the post. This didnt happen and I had to call for one. Got another appt for march where i just sat outside xray for an hour then had to leave as i rely on public transport and live in Middlesbrough (I did ask for an earlier appointment due to this factor along with the fact I am my sons carer and was refused), so I was informed I'd get another through the post, still hasnt happened. I called last week and got told theyve been off over easter - still no appointment. 

The person dealing with me knows I have a loose tooth, looks like I'll be losing it doesnt it.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Phlebotomy team
body:
Had a blood test today at Royal Liverpool and had a fantastic experience. I was so nervous and really didnâ€™t want to do it. They let me watch a friend have theirs and then they did mine. The lady doing it had 20 years experience which put my mind at ease. The whole team made me laugh the whole way through and it was done in seconds. I hope they are commended for their work. They made the whole experience positive! (Aside from being stabbed with a needle!)

Thank you again to the fantastic ladies!

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant experience
body: I was due to have a CT colonography procedure in the imaging department.  I arrived ready to read "War and Peace" from cover to cover!  However, I  waited no more than five minutes and then was taken through to the section and looked after by the most charming, efficient, helpful people that ever existed and was out on the street within little more than 30 minutes.   Thank you, thank you, thank you.

readBy.name: Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Lindavx23
authorRole: a service user
title: Gynecology story
body:
After having 3 kids, I had prolapse, stress incontinence, which was dramatically affected my life - I never went to concert, never drank any fluid when out ever due to fear of urinating, I couldn't do anything I enjoyed. It took 10 years to finally be passed from GP (constant "do pelvic floor" leaflets) to being referred to Katie - stress incontinence physio who was great.  
Once finding out had I had prolaspes and that my pelvic wall was fine, I got to see a consultant who's manner and way was horrible.  
Their registrar gave me my 3 bulked injections, they were lovely, then wanting a more permanent fix, met Dr Sokolva who was absolutely unreal. They listened and understood how this is effecting me, and understanding a more permanent fix was necessary, put me on their waiting list (unfortunately covid happened) but when I met them again on the day of my surgery, I felt like they remembered me even though it was 3 years later. They went over everything again in detail, and advised me of all risks involved, their style of communication is great, I honestly would have trusted this doctor with my life (well I did) and I don't know if they understand what this actually means to me.  
I'm only 2 days post op, sore but good, my life can finally begin again and I will be able to do all the stuff I loved before.  
When I think of the rude consultant, people like that shouldn't be allowed to be in that profession, no people skills, and I feel had an absolute disrespect for patients. I'm not the only person that has said this, but thank god I got Dr Sokolva, thank you so much.

readBy.name: NHS Ayrshire & Arran

title: Awful
body: Long queue to get through to the practice then cut off when they answer the phone. This is not helpful when I have a sick baby at home & need medical advice. This has happened on more than 1 occasion & isnâ€™t good enough. Terrible surgery.

author: jivebd85
authorRole: a relative
title: A professional and caring team
body:
Patient was feeling unwell, shortness of breath, weakness, low energy. Local GP visited patients home and made a diagnosis of possible pneumonia. Patient too weak to attend hospital so GP set up hospital homecare.  
This service was provided with a professional and caring team of nurses and Doctor. The service was exceptional. It meant the patient did not have to go to A&E for a long wait and was treated in the comfort of her own home. This is an invaluable service especially for the elderly and cannot recommend more highly this service.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: LD100%kind
authorRole: the patient
title: Thanks to all inc' fab nursing care team, drs, operating team
body:
After an abnormal smear I got a diagnosis of cervical cancer this was out of the blue and the support during diagnosis and pre op from nurse specialist Gillian and Gynae consultant at the Royal Alexandra Hospital (RAH) Paisley was invaluable. They always called me back and offered answers to all my questions and provided reassurance when I needed it.  
I was then admitted to Glasgow Royal Infirmary 2 months later for a radical hysterectomy with node dissection. I was scared and feeling vulnerable as I have cared for people for years as a LD nurse, support worker and phlebotomist but never been the patient .  
The surgeon Dr Burton was excellent, very professional, kind and reassuring . The staff on ward 56 gynae are marvellous, the work they do is beyond words. What they do day in day out not forgetting the wonderful Nightshift team seems effortless to them . They all work as a team and made me feel valued , listened to and cared for. They are an excellent teaching hospital with eager students in all areas of the hospital involved in my care .  
I had a rough week after my operation due to several things but they were there to support me and ensured my dignity at all times . Some people are natural carers and this team is full of them. Smiling, making you laugh and giving you hope . Whatever we literally threw at them they dealt with it. At a time when I felt vulnerable and needed to put my trust in others they came up trump's.  
I was given time to recover at my own pace and stayed an extra few days which allowed me to build up my strength. Thanks to all including fab nursing care team, drs, operating team especially the anaesthetist and guy who chatted to me about rugby to calm my nerves, surgeon, cleaners, physio, cup of tea providers and nurse specialist Nicola .

readBy.name: Scottish Government
NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde
Office of Jenni Minto, MSP for Argyll and Bute

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: They have been so wonderful
body:
I have to give praise to all of 3 North here as they have been so wonderful. I have been having chronic pain and it was near getting to the stage where I couldnâ€™t walk so they had to bring me into hospital to be checked. I have been on the 3 North ward for quite some time now. The physiotherapist has been absolutely amazing she has been by my side the whole time and helping me improve with my mobility so much. I canâ€™t just thank one member of staff as all has been great. The small gestures that they do is what makes it like there was a time I was dying for a drink of water so I informed one of the nurses about this and they brought me up a full jug straight from the fridge which was nice and cold just the way I like it and I found this to be quite lovely of them to do this.  
People are always so quick to give negative comments about our NHS and never as quick to give a compliment. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Phone call diagnoses
body: Consistently poor service and diagnoses due to lack of face to face communication. Sent to A&E or told to see a pharmacist seem to be the favoured approach. Got a rash, you had better be good at describing the symptoms because they won't look at it, just ask you to send a picture and we all know a picture just doesn't represent the true nature of the problem. We've been receiving consistently poor service from this surgery and are having to get treatment elsewhere for our family.

title: Well run
body: Parking is a huge issue. Once in the appointments run smoothly. Plenty of seats. Dr very pleasant and friendly.

title: Great Facility, Good People, Patheticallyâ€¦
body:
It is rare nowadays to call this surgery and not be told that there are more than 60 patients ahead of you in the queue. When I finally got through after more than an hour, and queried this, a navigator told me that the queue is often over 200..I was told the next available bookable appointment to see a GP was over two weeks , and I should try calling at 8.00 am the following morning or try the online appointment service, which goes live at 8.00, but shuts down once the days appointments are booked. I got online, and was thrown out before I could complete my booking, a matter of some 3 minutes, as the system was full and all appointments had gone. So I joined the queue on the phone to be told "there are currently more than 60 patients ahead of you", and the surgery is no longer operating a call back service, nor accepting 
e-consultations. When I finally got an appointment, I arrived 10 minutes early only to wait until a half hour after my appointment time before I was seen. I hasten to add, the staff and GP's are fine, but it couldn't be more glaringly obvious that this surgery, and Forest Gate, are grossly understaffed and unable to provide the service they themselves are capable of as a result. Somebody, somewhere please do something!! This is leading to people who genuinely need care, such as myself, no longer bothering to call because of the unbelievable frustration, which I imagine often worsens cases of chronic hypertension such as mine!

title: Best practice yet
body: Recently moved away from their catchment area, and am seriously sad about it. It's not perfect, but it's the best practice I've been at so far. You can actually reach them, book appointments within 2 weeks, get proper referrals and good use of the online system for prescription requests (which are done quickly). It's a real shame they only allow catchment patients, as everything nearby is horrid. Thank you

title: They will never see you
body: They won't let you book for the next day, even weeks out, only for today. By the time you get through to them on the phone (there is no voicemail) all "today" appointments are taken. Rinse and repeat the next day. You will effectively never be seen by this GP. Don't even bother registering, it's pointless.

title: Using Patchs to get urgent appointments is so easy
body: I logged on to Patchs at 8:10am, entered details of what was troubling me, had a message back within 10 mins, saying an appointment had been made for later in the morning to see a Dr.  Turned up at appointment time and only had to wait 5 mins.  Dr was very pleasant and professional and I was out within 10 / 15 mins with antibiotics and a referral to see a consultant.  The free one hour parking outside also makes a positive difference

title: 2 weeks notice for prescription
body: Ordered via online system, 4 working days later, still not reviewed, person dealing with it has been on leave. This will be the 4th prescription in a row that has taken around 10 working days to receive. Surprised they are advertising for new patients when they are not servicing current patients. Perhaps current patients are going elsewhere? Hmmm

readBy.name: Healthwatch Tameside

title: What Is Going On?
body: i phoned to ask for a regular blood test for hypothyroidism and diabetes. i gave instructions that I was available during half term (a full week) as I am a teacher. the receptionist told me I couldn't book an appointment and to call later. when I asked when she told me to call back to make an appointment in June when I would be back at work. when i told her I couldn't because of work she was abrupt and slammed the phone down on me. looks like you can't book a blood test with a practice that is 5 minutes walk away from me anymore. I expect I shall ignore the text messages to book appointments from now on if this is the attitude I'm expected to tolerate.

title: Unreliable practice
body: After been on the phone queue for 50 minutes, they donâ€™t answer the phone, if you go there in person they are always talking and not caring for the person. I saw that personally, they donâ€™t pick up the phone. It is a disgrace, we pay taxes for a service that doesnâ€™t work. If they are not fit for the job they should leave the position to somebody else that is careful.

title: Bad Practice and rude staff
body:
I called yesterday morning to book an appointment and there was an Option to request a call back which I did. But when a lady called me back at around 9:01am I was told there was no appointment left. And I asked if I could get a pre booked appointment then this lady was raising her voice at me and in her words â€œdo you need a translator because I just said there was no available appointment todayâ€ like who the hell does she think she is talking to me like her child. Yâ€™all will say you donâ€™t tolerate abuse of any kind towards your staff but is it normal for your staff to rude to a client. Very very disrespectful! 
This is the uptenth time in a row which I am calling to be seen by the Gp, with no success. How can I function properly and move on with my life and work when I am ailing? I donâ€™t know why the appointment system is this terrible. But it certainly needs some fix up.

title: Hopeless!
body: Skipton practice fall short in everything they do or rather not do.  Not sure why or how Modality are in the business of 'careing' for people.  As for the overly long discourteous message when you call and the repetitive one while the music blares at you while you are number 30 in the queue - no call you back service any more now!!

title: What's going on
body:
Dreadfully long wait times for appintments.

Not enough doctors because they have retired.

Why not just get some new doctors?

Was one of the first to register with the practice when it first opened.

Very disappointed with the way it seems to be heading!

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: One thing that I would improve is the waiting list times
body:
I have been dealing with my issues for quite some time now. I had to give up my employment as I become so restricted and have found it to be a very hard time dealing with all this.  
One thing that I was would be improved is the waiting list times as I have been waiting on this surgery for quite some time now and have only went through with it now. Now that I have been getting the treatment that I needed it has been really good, the staff couldn't have done any better than what they have given to me and I understand that staffing issues is a problem we face within our trust service and the only negative thing was the whole waiting list to get this done. That is the only major improvement that I would like to see changed as I know I am not alone in saying this and its quite sad that out service has come down to this.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Fantastic level of Service
body: Currently on absence from work with ongoing Back issue, and the Practice have offered a first class service in the way of fulfilling my medication requests, and the speed in which I receive my Sickness certificates for my company. Highly recommended

title: Good practice
body: My experience last time was  good, the staff were nice and patient, the nurse was great and cheerful wich made me feel comfortable, she listened to my probkem and helped me to make an appointement with the doctor

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Thank you to the staff here on 3 North
body: Thank you to the staff here on 3 North they have been very good to me and I feel as if they are treating me like a family member. When I first came into CAH I arrived in through ED and I was seen straight away. There was hardly anyone in ED which was shocking to me because anytime I have went to any hospital ED they have always been busy but this was a first which I was pleased to see. The service I received was first class and the advice given was very reassuring. It was very hard for me to go in on my own with no support but staff were able to step in and be very supportive to me which I am very grateful for. To be honest with you at the very start I was apprehensive but the staff were amazing and the surgery went very well.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Dangerous amount of traffic.
body:
I visited the hospital today to leave my blood vials at Pathology. I am on home heamodialysis. This deposit is time sensitive. As I approached the hospital at 2.25pm, the back up of traffic was ridiculous, queuing down towards Haslingden Road. We gave up and went for coffee for 35 minutes. On coming back, the traffic was worse. I ended up having to walk part way.  (Not good for someone just off dialysis). 
After leaving the hospital, another lady and I couldn't cross the zebra crossing outside the main entrance as a car was parked on it dropping someone off. The oblivious driver proceeded to reverse actually bumping both of us. 
The point of this review is that the traffic control at the hospital is horrendous. As a sight impaired person it certainly isn't safe. Perhaps it would be a good idea to have car park staff outside the building to try and control the chaotic traffic. It would definitely be safer for some of us.

readBy.name: East Lancashire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Awful practice
body:
I switched GP's due to a relocation; whilst the service at that practice wasn't ideal, it was light years better than this one.
I tried to obtain an appointment to discuss an ongoing - and painful - issue. 
After waiting around 15 mins just to have the call answered, was eventually told that appointments can only be booked online between 07:00-09:00 and that I should try again tomorrow as all appointments are "same day".
After explaining this was essentially a lottery and not acceptable, I was grudgingly offered a call back between 18:00-20:00 in ten days time.
I also raised the issue of my repeat prescription as all records appear to have been removed from the NHS app I was using.
I was told this would be sorted out immediately and the prescription would be raised that day.
I called the following day, and of course there's no prescription. I'm currently on hold - waiting 10 mins and counting - for someone to answer the phone so I can find out what happened to my meds.

It's an appalling practice, as soon as I've got my meds sorted out for the month I will be changing to a new one.

title: Quick service
body: Having been getting sane day appointment since the launch of â€˜PATCHSâ€™.it has made life and reaching out to the GP so much easier and hassle free.hats off to the person who implemented this approach.contacting the GP us no more a pain with hours of being on the waiting line.
